DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the blood transfusion type.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._The infusion of components of blood or whole blood into the bloodstream. The blood may be donated from another person, or it may have been taken from the person earlier and stored until needed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: platelet. An irregularly shaped disklike cytoplasmic fragment of a megakaryocyte that is shed in the marrow sinus and subsequently found in the peripheral blood where it functions in clotting. A platelet contains granules in the central part (granulomere) and, peripherally, clear protoplasm (hyalomere), but no definite nucleus; is about one-third to one-half the size of an erythrocyte; and contains no hemoglobin. (STED98)

Concepts.definition: An irregular, disc-shaped element in the blood that assists in blood clotting. Platelets are not blood cells, they are fragments of large bone marrow cells called megakaryocytes.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 9/20/22 Changed PV in Biomarker Name VD to Platelet (was previously Platelet Count, which is C51951). Then made a new Platelet Count PV for Biomarker Name VD. mr;

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm and little else; biconcave, anucleate discs, 7nm diameter in mammals.

Concepts.definition: A blood cell specialized for oxygen transport, having a high concentration of hemoglobin in the cytoplasm. They are biconcave, anucleate discs, with a 6-8um diameter in humans.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
The injection of whole blood or a blood component directly into the bloodstream.
